Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery ribbed vessel, the walls are quite thick and the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is partly spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393248) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393248)
